text:
A lot could be done. It’s a matter of challenge + creative thinking. 

You can build a button that exports a PDF or CSV of data for the record you are viewing if users find it tedious to collate the data from properties. 

Or you can build a table that shows real time info from an external DB like Snowflake or MySQL or even a custom ERP so reps don’t need to open multiple screens to work. 

Or build a button to clone a record, add its associations (or clone the associations themselves) with their labels so users don’t need to re-input it.

I find it easy to come up with something by reasoning ‘how can we reduce the work load for a user’. Hope this helps.

Hi everyone!

I've been developing a simple Custom UI Card to create a quote.
When I'm testing things out with "hs project dev" I always get an API 401 error saying "Authentication credentials not found".
However, if I upload the exact same project and test it, it works perfectly.
Does anyone else have the same? What can I do to fix this?
It's not that big of a deal, but the only way I can test my projects is if I upload it every time.
thanks <@U05CJMDM467> and <@U05KNCMAE7N> that's all helpful

Hi Miguel, can you confirm you have updated to the latest version of the CLI `npm i -g @HubSpot/cli@latest` ? Happy to help troubleshoot further if I can. I'm guessing you are attempting to do local development on a development sandbox and uploading to a production portal? You will need your PAK to be authorized for both portals to interact with projects.

I would start by confirming all the relevant portals are included when running `hs accounts list` . If not, you should use `hs auth` to request and add a new PAK for the CLI for the missing account (likely the development sandbox) and then try using `hs project dev` again.
<@U05KNCMAE7N> he's stealing my idea, <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C05R599UA12/p1704481720852749>
LOL it’s 1 to 1 now :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

Loving all this excitement for maps and I'd love to know more to help :smile: This might be kind of an obvious question (and I've asked this to <@U01QVR44MEY> before too), but <@U3T21PDBK>  can you tell me more about the why managing store locations, etc can't be solved using the components we currently have? And what do you expect your users to be able to do with this kind of a map?

These details help us build experiences that solve for your use cases. So thank you in advance!
fwiw this link – <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-ui-extensions#open-an-iframe-in-a-modal> – just goes to the page. There is no `#open-an-iframe-in-a-modal` section
Thanks, we will consider adding that. Can you tell me what you will use it for?
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> Awesome, my use case is that I need to make the person who is using the card the owner of the object that can be created using the card.

So, on the card you might have the button, that says make myself the owner?

Still not getting how having `ownerid` in context wiil help you though.
The card lets the person create a record. I need that the owner of that record is the person who created it through the card

Hi Chandni,

Are you trying to use Calling SDK inside UI extensions or are you building a calling extension separately?
Can you try this? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-sdk>

> my use case is that I need to make the person who is using the card the owner of the object that can be created using the card
If I'm following correctly, the id of the person _*using*_ the card should be `context.user.id` and you could use that as the owner id

Yeah right now I have an api call to the owners api to get the owner id using the user id but didn't know I could set a owner using the user id, it actually doesn't match the owner internal values but I'll give it a shot!
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-sdk#open-an-iframe-in-a-modal>
Oh gotcha, I misunderstood.  Yeah you will need to make the exchange using the API to lookup with the user id
This for your `HubSpot.config.yml` for the CLI authorization not the app
yeah it’s there! thank you
